page.title: 18Farming (2)
page.content: The intensive use of fertilisers, pesticides and fungicides is linked to a number of factors: Hybrid strains of plants are less resistant to disease and can only be grown satisfactorily with application of chemicals. This has an effect on the ecology. Marketing of the crop is difficult; many small local mills and processors have closed down, and the farmer must deal with larger more distant companies. The same large companies may insist on very high standards for produce, which places more weight on use of chemicals to produce crops of a high standard. The large companies that purchase farmers' produce are often the same ones that sell the chemicals. Small farmers may feel that much of their indepence has been eroded by central government and multi national conglomerates.
